adjectives.description: inefficient (comparative more inefficient, superlative most inefficient)

entries.meaning: Not efficient; not producing the effect intended or desired; inefficacious
Incapable of, or indisposed to, effective action; habitually slack or unproductive; effecting little or nothing
examples: The Defense Department, for example, has greatly expanded competitive bidding and is this year submitting to Congress the first-ever 2-year defense budget to replace the old, inefficient, year-by-year process.

entries.meaning: A person who cannot or does not work efficiently.
examples: Two men were put to work who could not set their looms; a third man was taken on who helped the inefficients to set the looms. The other weavers thought this was a breach of their union rules and 18 of them struck  […]
